description.narrative: To support Institute for Motivating Self-Employment's efforts to document how climate change is threatening the livelihoods of vulnerable and poor communities in selected villages in Sunderban. One of the goals is to raise local awareness of the climate change issues and impacts; and another goal is to initiate a dialogue with local government to address issues like loss of livelihoods and displacements caused by climate change. The following activities will be carried out in selected Gram Panchayet (local self-government–village level) in Sunderban community: focused group discussions on climate change and food security; interviews at community levels; collecting evidence and preparing research on climate change impacts; carrying out Fact Finding Mission (FFM) involving a variety of experts, and publishing reports and info materials for awareness raising on Right To Food (RTF) and Climate Change
